text: just in time for the opening of London
Fashion Week this weekend comes a skirt
made of phones yep as we wait for that
future where your clothes are smart
this knee-length number is made of 80
Nakia smartphones running a special app
that simulates a portion of a virtual
fabric on each screen as the model walks
and turns the handsets detect the
movement and the design appears to move
and shimmer like real material this is
really fascinating just to sit here and
watch and fair enough you're not
actually going to be able to buy this
skirt in your local clothes shop not
anytime soon anyway but the story of how
it was created
does contain a serious thread of geek
it's a collaborative project between
Nokia who supplied the phones fashion
designer Fyodor Golan and London design
how skin even though the skirt went
through several traditional shall we say
analog stages the clips holding each
phone to the wireframe with 3d printed
to the exact measurement and orientation
required the skirt does take a lot of
charging and the phones then need to be
calibrated each handset makes contacts
with a central server to download images
and synchronized timings now I was up
wearing this myself but sadly it's not
made for someone of my proportions I'm
all for minimizing waste but this is
ridiculous
waste do you see waste
